Happy Nude Rears my Dearest Perverts!

While I nurse my cold back to health, crack on with my to-do lists and slowly boot up for a brand new year, Isabella Rotman is BACK with another wonderful comic (check out her previous DIY harness piece here!). Today she’s interviewing our long time friend (with business benefits) Searah, who runs one of the nicest sex toy shop in the states, Early to Bed. Some of our first ever sex toys came from Searah, they’ve been with OJST ever since the start, and heck, it’s just the best.

“Mutual Masturbation” can also sometimes be used to describe Manual Sex (The act of sexually stimulating another person with one’s hands), but for the purpose of this comic I’m just using it to refer to parallel solo play between folks who aren’t in contact with each other.

Want to read some more? OF COURSE YOU DO, MY SWEETEST PERVERT.

item.title: (A Version of) the Sexual Response Cycle
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: I took some liberty with my listing of the sexual response stages, as I already noted in the comic above. Most commonly, when people talk about the SRC, they’re referring to the classic Masters and Johnson’s four phase model, which just includes Excitement, Plateau, Orgasm, and Resolution. But then Kaplan came along in the 1970s […]
item.content:encoded:
(A Version of) the Sexual Response Cycle

by Erika Moen on 12/12/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Health »
  • Sex & Sexuality

I took some liberty with my listing of the sexual response stages, as I already noted in the comic above. Most commonly, when people talk about the SRC, they’re referring to the classic Masters and Johnson’s four phase model, which just includes Excitement, Plateau, Orgasm, and Resolution. But then Kaplan came along in the 1970s and was like ‘Whoah, whoah, you guys left out step one: DESIRE. And also I think we can condense this a bit?’ so she reshuffled some stuff around and developed the three phase Triphasic model, which starts with Desire, proceeds to Excitement, and then concludes with Resolution. I think of OJST comics as appetizers, a small snack to wet your appetite before you fill up on the main course– so if the various stages of sexual response that I mashed together in today’s strip interest you, I hope you’ll be inspired to do some more research on them yourself!

You may have noted that I recommended folks read Dr. Emily Nagoski’s life-changing book, Come As You Are, to better learn about the Sexual Response Cycle, but if you don’t have the time to commit to that right now I’d also like to point you towards this guest comic that she and my good friend R. Stevens did for us on The Science of Desire (The Dual Control Model).

Further Reading:


► Sexual Response & Orgasm: A Users Guide on Scarleteen
► How do I have good sex? on Planned Parenthood
► How to Understand, Identify and Make Choices About Desire on Scarleteen
► Yield for Pleasure on Scarleteen
► How can you tell if you’ve had an orgasm? on Planned Parenthood
► Why can’t I orgasm? on Scarleteen
► When the Big O is a No-Show on Scarleteen
► Lions and Tigers and Orgasms, Oh My! When Orgasm Seems Scary on Scarleteen

If you appreciated reading those articles above, please consider donating to Scarleteen and Planned Parenthood for generously providing them to us in the first place!

└ Tags: desire, education, excitement, kaplan, masters and johnson, orgasm, phase, plateau, resolution, science, sexual response, sexual response cycle, stage, triphasic

by Matthew Nolan on 12/05/2017 at 12:01 am

Another year FLIES BY and, yeesh, what a year.

This’ll be our FOURTH Best Of! And jeez, the list gets bigger and bigger each time. If you’re interested, check our 2016, 2015, 2014 Best Ofs! You can peek at just how much our art has changed and evolved, plus you get to see that a lot of the toys we’re recommending are still on our list: they are that good!

Before I link you our specific reviews and whatnots, here’s a list of our fav stores for you to hit up if you fancy picking up a toy. We trust ’em and love them all!

by Matthew Nolan on 11/14/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »

I was so excited to get this comic from Crystal. Not only is it a hard and personal thing to write and comic about, but look at how great this comic issssss. So good.

This week and the next, we’re doing guest comics while Erika and I settle down and crack on with some secret project work (which I think we’ll start excitedly talking about in 2018), and take a few days to decompress during. These past few weeks we’ve been trying to up our sex-education-comics game, and that stuff is HARD WORK. We need to give them plenty of bonus hours to really hammer out a good script!

In the meantime, check out some of Crystal’s amazing work:

item.title: Turbo Thrust
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Any day I get Erika to draw some Destiny 2 fan art for me is a GOOD day. Today’s review is probably not the most in-depth, but I liked this toy enough to pass on my spare to a friend – it’s a real good cock sleeve – and I think it’s really doing something […]
item.content:encoded:
Turbo Thrust

by Matthew Nolan on 11/07/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

Any day I get Erika to draw some Destiny 2 fan art for me is a GOOD day.

Today’s review is probably not the most in-depth, but I liked this toy enough to pass on my spare to a friend – it’s a real good cock sleeve – and I think it’s really doing something new that actually feels good. A lot of other toys and companies are trying out new novelty things that end up just being superfluous but the Turbo Thrust isn’t one of them!

I don’t really know if you NEED this toy next to your bedside. Especially since Fleshlight has been re-releasing my most fav model, the Sex in a Can Anal model – which I super reccomend. Buttttt while the Turbo’s cost and size can be pretty crazy, if you’ve got some spare pocket money and a bigger than average cock, I think it’s a sure bet for a fun time.

I think Early to Bed’s description line says it all really: ‘Gah.. how gorgeous is this?’

item.title: Am I Ready For Sex?
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.category: HOW will it impact my life?
why do I want to have sex?
item.description: Haha, oh jeez, I’ve been avoiding this comic since we launched four years ago. “How do I know if I’m ready for sex?” (and variations of that question) is one of our most frequently requested topics and it’s… it’s a hard one! Hence my avoidance. BUT. No more dodging it. Here’s our INTRODUCTORY stab at […]
item.content:encoded:
Am I Ready For Sex?

by Erika Moen on 10/31/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • How To »
  • Sex & Sexuality

Haha, oh jeez, I’ve been avoiding this comic since we launched four years ago. “How do I know if I’m ready for sex?” (and variations of that question) is one of our most frequently requested topics and it’s… it’s a hard one! Hence my avoidance. BUT. No more dodging it. Here’s our INTRODUCTORY stab at this subject. Matt and I tried our best, but there’s no way we could possibly cover every single thing you’ll want to consider, which is why we REALLY recommend you read up some more at the links below and keep asking yourself questions, see where it takes you. Sex is a personal world of continued self-discovery, you’re always going to be learning and evolving over time. And, SUPER IMPORTANT: SEX IS SO MUCH MORE THAN A PENIS GOING IN A VAGINA. Phew, ok, now you should go read the rest of these links…

Am I Ready for Sex? – Planned Parenthood
Ready or Not? The Scarleteen Sex Readiness Checklist – Scarleteen
I don’t feel ready for sex at all: should I? – Scarleteen
I’m 13 and Totally Sure I’m Ready for Sex – Scarleteen

Since this IS a wordy comic, I’m going to bullet point the core questions we recommend you ask yourself, just so you have a short go-to list here in the blog:
Ask yourself:
– WHY do I want to have sex?
– WHAT am I comfortable doing?
– HOW will it impact my life, those around me, and myself as a person.

AND finally, it’s worth TRIPLE saying here again:
Sex is supposed to be a positive, intimate activity for everyone involved. If anything ever feels contrary to that, stop and reassess!

└ Tags: am I ready for sex?, first time, HOW will it impact my life?, Impact, personal, questions, ready, support, viginity, virgin, what am I comfortable trying?, why do I want to have sex?, you
